title: Penne Pasta With Arugula, Mascarpone, And "bacon
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Penne Pasta With Arugula, Mascarpone, And "bacon a try. One serving contains 153 calories, 5g of protein, and 4g of fat. This recipe serves 4 and costs 44 cents per serving. This recipe from Running With Tweezers has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. A mixture of chili flakes, mascarpone cheese, tubular shaped pasta, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. With a spoonacular score of 63%, this dish is good. Similar recipes include Bacon Provolone Penne Pasta Bake, Penne With Sausage, Peas and Mascarpone, and Cook the Book: Penne with Mascarpone.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
